( 14 )
tional Powers, which make up our Legislature,
or any of them upon an equality with the ASSOCIATION;
but this would have been below so
powerful a Body, which as it created itself, must
therefore be more than omnipotent, and of
course the ASSOCIATION has set itself above the
Constitution and the established Government;
without so much as mentioning the Governor,
Council or Assembly, in their Legislative Capacity,
—and created themselves a Body, for carrying
on good Government. Thus are our Constitution,
Laws and Government, subjected to
an illegal, Anti-constitutional ASSOCIATION,
and the charming Sound of Harmony, converted
into a discordant, illegal governing Power.
So much for the specious Preamble and first
Resolution; we now come to the second Resolution,
viz.
II. “ We Resolve not to propose any Bills"
in either House, or take any Step, whereby"
the Publick may be affected, without first"
consulting the other Members of this
" ASSOCIATION, and having their Approbation.
By this second Resolution, the Mask of Dissimulation
is quite thrown aside, and the two
Houses of Council and Assembly, tho' not laid
totally aside by the ASSOCIATION, are only nominally
to be made use of, as Tools of Conveyance
and Countenance to Bills passed at the ASSOCIATION-Board.
Thus was His Majesty's
Privy-
